item.title: Frederick add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Frederick add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Frederick add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
